address: Estr. da G√°vea, 800 - S√£o Conrado, Rio de Janeiro - RJ, 22610-002, Brazil

reviews.text: Our son's in-laws' parents invited us to this most beautiful golf and country club in a subburb of Rio. I rented some nice clubs, we had a cart and a great caddy. I saw someone walking the course, which is very difficult for many holes. The hills are quite steep. Thus, our pleasant caddy, Antonio, was able to maneuver the course quickly and efficiently. He grabbed our needed clubs in advance.  Antonio gave me many gracious pointers that I needed. Some of the front 9 holes overlook the ocean, and many have stunning views of the forest, sugar loaf mountain, etc. I saw a variety of lovely birds on this incredible course but was truly distracted by a couple of colorful Tucans. We ate a delicious meal poolside while our grandkids swam. Danilo, our server, was attentive and friendly. Before leaving, the grandkids got to play minigolf, swing, and enjoy the playground, located above  the pool area. The changing rooms, showers, and restrooms are all impeccable. We highly recommend this top-notch golf course to those who like a challenge and have the time to enjoy the game of golf ‚õ≥Ô∏è üëç. Thank you, Gavea golf and Country Club.
Great Course! They just sanded/plugged the greens, but still playable. Good mix of mountain and resort style holes.  My caddie was great.  Would love to play again.
Great golf course and great caddies

*This is an updated review, since my last one 7 or 8 months ago...*
The course is challenging as the majority of it is mountainous. Well kept greens and fairways. The driving range is pretty small, (maybe room for 10 golfers at a time). There are also 2 putting greens that are well kept.
I HAD issues with the service as it is a quasi private club and if you are not a member or accompanied by a member, the staff was a little stand-off-ish.
They are more receptive now that I have visited numerous times and they are somewhat familiar with me. Other friends of mine that don't play that often still complain though. A few individuals however are awesome!
I have upgraded my rating from 3 to 4 stars!
Impossible to make a reservation here. No one can communicate. I‚Äôve called and emailed multiple times. Not welcoming.

reviews.text:
Laranjeiras (Portuguese pronunciation: [la…æ…êÃÉÀà íej…æ…ê É], orange trees) is an upper-middle-class neighborhood located in the South Zone of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. Primarily residential, It is one of the city's oldest neighborhoods, having been founded in the 17th century, with the construction of country houses in the valley located around the Carioca River, which bordered Corcovado Mountain. Because of this, the neighborhood was previously called Vale do Carioca, or Carioca Valley.

While primarily residential, several important governmental, cultural, and sports institutions and schools make this a bustling neighborhood. Well known landmarks in Laranjeiras include the Pal√°cio Guanabara (seat of the state government of Rio de Janeiro), the Pal√°cio Laranjeiras (official residence of the state's governor), and the Parque Guinle (Eduardo Guinle Park), as well as the headquarters and Laranjeiras Stadium of Fluminense Football Club, and Rio's branch of the Hebraica Social and Sports Club, and several others.
